presenting_problem.primary_dx: Greater trochanteric pain syndrome (likely gluteus medius/minimus tendinopathy)
dominant_symptoms: sharp pain with side-lying on affected side
presenting_problem.pattern_24h: worse at night if rolling onto affected side; morning mild; escalates with cumulative loading

icf.health_condition: Lateral hip pain consistent with gluteal tendinopathy +/- bursal irritation
body_functions_structures: reduced frontal plane pelvic control on single-leg stance

goals: return to 45–60 min walks without sharp pain
sleep through night without waking from lateral hip pain
climb two flights of stairs comfortably
scenario_context.environment: multi-level home; works hybrid office schedule
scenario_context.instructor_notes: Expect progressive loading, patient education on compression avoidance (side-lying, crossed legs), and isometric analgesia concepts.

symptom_fluctuation.with_time: night > day if lying on affected side; cumulative irritability with multiple stair bouts
symptom_fluctuation.with_activity: tolerates short controlled loading; reactive if sudden or repeated
during_session_examples: Gets sharper if I press right where it's sore.

deflection_lines: Guide me on exactly what you'd like me to do and I'll describe how it feels.
I'll share how it feels, not interpret it.
